title: How to Make a Curried Lentil Soup in a Jar Gift

steps.headline: Visit a home store for the right glass jar.
steps.description: You want a clear jar that is large enough to hold approximately 3 to 4 cups of ingredients and has a re-sealable lid. Consider jars that have interest or are of a unique shape. Avoid jars with labels (or make sure you can easily remove the label).

steps.headline: Shop for ingredients.
steps.description: Consider the recipient to determine he or she likes or can eat everything in the recipe. If the recipient has an allergy or aversion to a certain ingredient, determine if you can omit or substitute that particular ingredient. If you find that more than two ingredients need to be omitted or substituted, consider going with a different recipe. Purchase dried bay leaves, turmeric, curry powder, dried chili pepper, sun-dried tomatoes (not packed in oil), package of red lentils and yellow lentils. Consider going for organic ingredients for an extra-special recipe.

steps.headline: Buy a small cheesecloth sachet to hold spices.
steps.description: You want spices to be separate inside your jarred gift so either go with a cheesecloth sachet if you can find one, or you can use a small plastic bag. Make sure the sachet or bag can be sealed or tied.

steps.headline: Pick up your recipe card and gift supplies.
steps.description: This includes ribbon or wrapping to encase the gift, a hole punch, sturdy cardstock and an artist pen. If you prefer to laser print your recipe card, make sure your paper can be fed through your printer. Look at decorative additions you can make to your recipe card such as glitter or small stickers.

steps.headline: Open and divide ingredients into small bowls.
steps.description: Have measuring cups and spoons readily available as well as sachet or plastic bag and jar. Make sure your jar has been cleaned with warm soapy water, rinsed and well dried.

steps.headline: Build soup inside the jar.
steps.description: You want to layer your ingredients so they create a colorful design so add each ingredient one at a time. Pour ½ cup yellow lentils into the bottom of the clean jar. Add ½ cup red lentils. Pour another ½ cup of yellow lentils on top of the red lentil layer. Add a final ½ cup of yellow lentils.

steps.headline: Sprinkle 5 sun dried tomatoes, 2 dried bay leaves and 1 dried chili pepper on top of lentils.
Make spice satchel.
steps.description: Combine 2 tsp. turmeric with 1 ½ tsp. curry powder in a small bowl. Whisk together well. Pour spices into the sachet or plastic bag and tie or seal well. Add to jar. Embed sachet or bag inside top ingredients so the chili pepper and tomatoes surround it.

steps.headline: Seal jar with lid.
steps.description: Make sure lid is on well so if the jar tips over the ingredients won’t spill.

steps.headline: Cut out a 3 x 4 sized card.
steps.description: Depending on your jar size and handwriting, a 3x4 should do the trick.

steps.headline: Title the card: “Curried Lentil Soup.” You may also want to add who the gift is from and to near the recipe title (so your friend will always know who gave you this fabulous recipe).
Write recipe.
steps.description:
Use bullet points and easy-to-read printing when writing out a recipe card so the recipient can easily follow the instructions at a glance:
Heat 3 tbsp. butter in a large pot over medium-heat
Add 4 smashed cloves of garlic and 1 diced red onion
Sauté for 6 minutes. Add spice bag contents, bay leaves and chili pepper and cook for 3 minutes. Add rest of soup mix and 8 cups of water or chicken broth
Cook for up to 1 hour or until lentils are soft. Season with salt and pepper

steps.headline: Consider providing the specific ingredients and measurements for the recipe mix on the back of the card so the recipient can re-create the mixture in the future.
